pageContext.claim: “When you get millions of ballots. I heard numbers like 80 million ballots [sent to registered voters automatically].”
pageContext.analysis: All wrong. Some states were mailing ballots to all registered voters, accounting for 51 million voters combined, according to a Washington Post tally. (In California alone, that means 20 million ballots were mailed.) Other states, with a combined 44 million voters, were simply mailing ballot applications. In all of these cases, people had to register to vote before receiving a ballot or ballot application in the mail.
